page.title: 17West Kingsdown & Employment
page.content:
{West Kingsdown}does not offer much scope for local employment. There are a{few jobs}being created on the small {light industrial estates}springing up in the village in the wake of nearby motorway developments. This apart, the few{shops}and{cafes}offer very{few {local opportunities.} There are farms around, but their activities are no longer labour intensive.
Most of the{working population}in{West {Kingsdown}commutes to{work}in{London. Not being served by a local railway line this generates a lot of vehicular traffic at peak hours. Over the past five years a number of{coach-based {commuting operations}have sprung up, covering all the local villages. In addition, the major{bus}company has established a{regular, fast service}to the{capital.
